com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.input
Interface InputSource2

All Known Implementing Classes:
ClassResourceInputSource2, FileInputSource2, StringInputSource2
public interface InputSource2

Union of byte- and character-based streams to be used as input. Inspired by David Megginson's InputSource from SAX, but named with a suffix '2' to prevent name clashes.

Exactly one byte- or one character-based stream is encapsulated by each instance. It is never safe to reuse an input source, as Java byte- and character-streams cannot always reliably be reset (to offset zero).

When possible, implementations are strongly recommended to override Object.toString() to provide a human-readable description of the source for logging and debugging purposes.

About Object.hashCode() and Object.equals(Object): They are normally not overridden by implementations as not all streams are guaranteed to be seekable (rewindable) in Java. As a result, instances of this class should not be re-used.

Author:
Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
See Also:
InputSource, StringInputSource2, FileInputSource2, ClassResourceInputSource2, PropertiesLoader

Method Summary
 InputStream getByteStream()
          Retrieves the byte-based stream.
 Reader getCharacterStream()
          Retrieves the character-based stream.
 

Method Detail

getByteStream

InputStream getByteStream()
Retrieves the byte-based stream. If this stream is null, the character-based stream must not be null.

See Also:
getCharacterStream()

getCharacterStream

Reader getCharacterStream()
Retrieves the character-based stream. If this stream is null, the byte-based stream must not be null.

See Also:
getByteStream()
